characters.name: Vraxen the Knife
characters.bio: A master thief who has robbed a hundred merchant princes. Attempted to rob the idol of Khar-Zul in its inner temple, prying six of nine emerald eyes free before the shadows came alive. Escaped with six gems but gained a new companion: a shadow wearing his own face, patient as carved stone, crouching beside him at dawn. His fate thereafter is unknown.

characters.name: Soraya
characters.bio: A renowned sell-sword hired to escort merchant caravans. Killed nine blood-cursed drivers on the Ashen Wastes when she discovered her employer Aldric had sold them to a sorcerer. Slew the sorcerer last, slowly. Kept none of Aldric's gold, but stole his shadow and sold it in the night markets of Pelimor. Tells herself it was justice.

characters.name: Aldric
characters.bio: A spice merchant operating on the Ashen Wastes route. Hired Soraya as a sell-sword escort, while secretly paying bandits, toll-lords, and a blood-sorcerer to smooth his passage. His drivers were transformed into shadow-eyed killers. Survived the journey but had his shadow stolen by Soraya and sold in Pelimor's night markets.

characters.name: Malachite Doss
characters.bio: A scholar of ancient ruins who descended into the Sunken Ziggurat of Yeng and found the Lamp of Suroth. Lit it in exchange for one truth and the destruction of one lie he had lived by. Learned his dead wife had never loved him — only his library — a truth he had suppressed for thirty years. The flame consumed his belief that knowledge was its own reward. Left the ruin lighter and heavier at once, no longer certain of his life's purpose.

characters.name: Kael Bloodhorn
characters.bio: Chieftain who brought 800 Veth warriors to siege the Bone Citadel, a living fortress of bone-white stone. Lost 700 warriors to its defenses before reaching the heart chamber. Sent his last 100 through drainage tunnels with torches; they were absorbed into the Citadel's walls — alive, preserved, breathing, visible like insects in amber. Kael spent the rest of his life attempting to free them. He failed. He never stopped trying.

characters.name: Tessaly Dorn
characters.status: active — in service to the dead
characters.bio: An adventurer who spent twelve gold coins from Yarithax's hoard before reading the inscription: 'This debt is not yet settled.' The Lich-King's grey collectors found her — two thin men who walk through walls and never sleep. After failing to pay with soul or years, she settled an eleven-month debt working as a collector herself, chasing debts for the dead. She collected punctually. She understood the job.

characters.name: Pieter Vane
characters.status: presumed dead / claimed by the dead
characters.bio: A man who broke his oath to a dead king on a Tuesday, for twenty gold pieces and a horse. The horse went lame; the gold was spent in a month. The dead king found him in a dockside tavern three provinces away the following Wednesday — patient, without threat. Pieter recited the oath from memory without being asked; he had never forgotten it. He paid his tab, followed the dead king into the cold street, and was never seen again. A new unmarked tomb appeared on the north road soon after.

characters.name: Conjuress Mel
characters.bio: A conjuress who owed three favors to the demon Varek for spells cast during the Siege of Amrath. The first favor: deliver a letter to a dead man — completed. The second: steal a year from a sleeping child — refused, punished, ultimately complied. The third, named on her wedding morning: her marriage itself — happiness as collection. Instead she drew a binding circle she had months to prepare and offered Varek an unprecedented counter: herself as a fellow collector of intangibles. Varek agreed. They work together now.

characters.name: Varek
characters.bio: An elegant demon who deals in intangibles: years of life, happiness, certainty, loyalty. Made a three-favor contract with Conjuress Mel during the Siege of Amrath. Planned to claim her marriage (happiness) as his third collection, but was outmaneuvered when she offered herself as a partner-collector instead. Accepted, as it was a better arrangement for both. Now collects alongside Mel.

characters.name: Urgha the Unmoved
characters.bio: A mercenary of fearsome reputation, named for her emotional detachment. Hired by an emperor to retrieve a tax collector's funds or his ears. Instead showed mercy when she found the collector had spent the money on physicians for his ill daughter. She kept neither money nor ears, sent her own personal physician to treat the child, and paid out of pocket. She remained unmoved — and was very angry about having shown mercy for years afterward.

characters.name: Cassia Vorn
characters.bio: The last thief of Crimson Gate, a city burned with three thousand people inside. Negotiated with a demon past all the standard offers (wealth, power, enemy's life) until the demon, unused to educated clients, dropped its script and simply asked what she wanted. She wanted the name of the man who burned Crimson Gate — information, not power, the currency of an older economy. She traded her certainty (intoxicating to beings made of doubt) for the name, then used it. She is notably less certain now, but the name was used.
characters.first_story: The Last Thief of Crimson Gate

story_appearances.title: The Last Thief of Crimson Gate

characters.name: King Aldous III
characters.bio: Won a desperate war by wearing the Plague-Bringer's Crown from the sealed vault beneath Ostern for thirty seconds. The gambit worked — the enemy surrendered rather than face a man with nothing left to lose. Reigned eleven more years: erratic, sleepless, prone to speaking to people who were not in the room. His shadow had been on backwards for years, which the physicians noted only after his death by ordinary causes. The Crown was returned to Ostern, which built a deeper vault.

characters.name: Malachar the Betrayer
characters.bio: A fallen warrior who sold his soul to daemon-priests for power, conquering kingdoms for three decades. When they came to collect, he denied them by driving his own blade through his heart.

characters.name: Shara
characters.bio: Once a slave in witch-queen Thysara's palace, Shara discovered hidden power within herself and overthrew her immortal oppressor to free the Scorched Wastes.

characters.name: Grell Ironhand
characters.bio: The greatest sellsword in the Shattered Provinces until a magic plague took his sword arm. Had metal grafted in its place, then chose honor over a dark cure when he crushed the Heartstone of Vulgrim.

characters.name: Zareth
characters.bio: A scholarly prince who studied dying stars and communed with the Elder Stones. Rejected cosmic fatalism and vowed to build observatories so mankind could read the new heavens.

characters.name: Kessa the Thief
characters.bio: A master thief who stole the Eye of Aethon from a sleeping god's temple. Pursued by her own shadow made monstrous, she embraced the darkness and merged with it, gaining perfect balance.
characters.first_story: The Debt of Kessa the Thief

story_appearances.title: The Debt of Kessa the Thief

characters.name: Dravok
characters.bio: A sorcerer-king who conquered three empires through will and black magic. When his runes of immortality faded, he sought the Gambler's Daemon in the Crimson Sanctuary for one final wager.

characters.name: Torven
characters.bio: A pearl diver who ventured into the Sunken Caverns to save his drowning village. Instead of taking the Lamia's Pearl, he accepted the Lamia's tears and brought her into the light.

characters.name: Vex the Curse-Bearer
characters.bio: A woman born with a curse that twisted every kindness she performed into catastrophe, causing collateral deaths and plague. She became a mercenary to align her curse with violence, believing this gave it purpose. After killing a sorcerer who claimed to have lifted the curse, she realized her curse was a gift teaching that intention and consequence are never simple.

characters.name: Morgath
characters.bio: A great sorcerer who conquered death through necromancy but found immortality hollow. Sealed away all knowledge of necromancy and walked willingly into the Eternal Dark, finding forgiveness at last.

characters.name: Kael the Nameless
characters.bio: A shadow-broker who dealt in stolen identities and borrowed faces in the gambling dens of Xul'thyris. Hired to sever the High Magistrate's shadow from light and stone, Kael discovered that shadows hunger and remember their owners. He was consumed by his own theft, becoming nothing but darkness wearing skin.

characters.name: Mordica the Bone-Carver
characters.tagline: Sculptor of suffering. Forty years. Consumed.
characters.bio: A bone-carver for forty years who carved phylacteries and spirit-binding totems without moral question. Hired by a widow to bind her daughter's remains with anguish, she created a monument in bone and suffering—only to become the final piece of the widow's terrible work.

characters.name: Yareth
characters.bio: A steppe-rider searching the blasted steppes for her brother, lost during a war for the Sunken Wells. She bargained with a being of impossible nature for his return—trading seven years of her joy. Her brother returned unchanged but amnesiac, and Yareth exists in a hollow shell, her emotions consumed by the bargain.

characters.name: Caros the Fortunate
characters.bio: A fortunate thief who stumbled upon Morthaxes's cursed treasure in Castle Greymarch—ten thousand gold coins stamped with a Lich-King's visage. The coins could not be spent or destroyed; their debt compounded daily until Caros owed more than could exist. The Collector claimed him when his flesh had nothing left to offer.

characters.name: Morg
characters.bio: A tomb-keeper sworn in blood-oath to guard the Tomb of Shard-Vêl for twelve years, part of a lineage of guardians. When the Plague Wars ended and no successors came, the living tomb grew hungry. Morg's oath prevented him from breaking his vow; instead, the tomb consumed him piece by piece, incorporating his bones into its burial chamber.

characters.name: Sister Kess
characters.bio: A novice sister who broke her vows to seek the Witch of Ravenmoor, desperate to save the plague-village of Carrion's Rest. The witch lifted the plague but cursed Kess with absolute truth—she could never lie again. She saved the village but destroyed herself, unable to offer comfort or hide doubt, each truth shattered faith.

characters.name: Kessara
characters.bio: A widow who ruled the Sunken Marches in name only while her dead husband Velgrim the Terrible held true power as a practical, vengeful ghost. Rather than submit to his demands for massacre, Kessara performed a ritual of dismissal, sacrificing her claim to the land itself to release his spirit. She departed as a wanderer, leaving the Marches to her husband's eternal rule.

characters.name: Master Lethyn
characters.bio: An alchemist who perfected a potion of youth through extraction of living flesh. What began as voluntary sacrifice became coerced theft and murder as his hunger grew beyond control. His own transformation into a flesh-eating thing was irreversible; he burned for three days while still consuming, his screams part of his alchemy.

characters.name: Thorne
characters.bio: A warden sworn by blood-oath to defend Grimmholt fortress against the Rot-King's forces. When the Crown ordered him to surrender the fortress, Thorne faced a choice between breaking his oath or treason. He chose rebellion, sealing the gates and holding against both the Rot-King and royal armies for two years. He died unburdened when his betrayed fortress fell.

characters.name: Nara the Tide-Thief
characters.bio: A thief who stole water-magic from the merfolk of the Sapphire Deep. Hunted across three continents for years, she learned that the sea cannot be stolen from—only reclaimed. Cornered in the desert city of Vel-Karsh, she bound her stolen magic into a single glass vial and shattered it, transforming the world to settle her debt. The merfolk accepted the reshaping as payment.

characters.name: Velgrim the Terrible
characters.bio: A powerful warlord who died three seasons before the events of his story but refused to pass into final death. His ghost manifested as a practical, demanding presence in the Sunken Marches, directing sieges and collecting tribute. He was finally released to peaceful death when his widow Kessara sacrificed her claim to the throne.

characters.name: Witch of Ravenmoor
characters.bio: An ancient witch dwelling in Ravenmoor, she offered mercy to Sister Kess when plague ravaged Carrion's Rest. Her price was Kess's ability to lie—a curse that forced absolute truth forever. She imposed this bargain knowingly, watching with approval as the curse destroyed Kess from within, viewing the suffering as poetic justice for mercy's true cost.

characters.name: Harrow the Copper-Fingered
characters.bio: Harrow the Copper-Fingered was a master thief who knew three things: lock-picking, shadow-movement, and escape. He stole the Crown of Karesh from the Tomb of Karesh, triggering an ancient curse that slowly rotted his body from within. Rather than endure the decay, he bartered his remaining years to a nameless merchant in Pelimor for oblivion.

characters.name: Vex the Shade-Merchant
characters.bio: A merchant of shadows in Pelimor's night markets who buys and sells secrets without names. Vex purchased what he believed was a powerful shadow, unaware the cloaked woman had stolen his own shadow months prior and was now selling it back to him. By dawn, he fled east through the blasted lands, driven by a will not his own.

characters.name: The Cloaked Woman
characters.bio: An unnamed woman who stole Vex's shadow months ago, then sold it back to him for three hundred gold pieces and safe passage east. She demonstrated knowledge of shadow-memory and used the transaction to pass control of Vex to the shadow itself.

characters.name: Gorven the Conjurer
characters.bio: A conjurer who summoned the minor demon Kesh and bound it to steal the life-force of his rival Meredith the Red. He claimed her properties and titles, but ignored the binding scroll's fine runes. When the demon collected its due—seven years of life from Gorven—he aged catastrophically and attempted to summon Kesh again. The demon returned unbounded and collected decades, leaving Gorven as a withered corpse.

characters.name: Meredith the Red
characters.bio: A rival of Gorven the Conjurer whose life-force was stolen by the demon Kesh. She withered within a week of the curse, losing her properties, titles, and students to Gorven.

characters.name: Kesh
characters.bio: A minor demon summoned by Gorven the Conjurer and bound to steal life-force from Meredith the Red. Kesh collected the stolen life according to the binding's fine runes. When Gorven attempted re-summoning, Kesh came unbounded and hungrily collected decades of Gorven's life instead of days, leaving him a withered corpse.

characters.name: Naresh the Bone Carver
characters.bio: A master bone carver who spent thirty years perfecting her art, inscribing power into bone and marrow. On the night of the blue eclipse, she carved and animated a full skeletal servant, but the spell's cost was her humanity itself—paid incrementally as sensation, taste, and need for sleep fled her body.

characters.name: Saleth
characters.bio: A man who swore a seven-year oath to the warlord Morne to guard his tomb, but on the eighth year broke his vow, stealing Morne's signet ring and fleeing south. Pursued by Morne's shade for five years, he eventually confessed and returned the ring, but remained bound to the grave by the unforgiving oath.

characters.name: Morne
characters.bio: A warlord whose tomb was sworn to be guarded by Saleth for seven years. Though dead, Morne's shade manifested as a pale bone figure to punish Saleth's oath-breaking, standing watch over him each night for five years until the oath-breaker confessed and bound himself to the grave.

characters.name: Vetch
characters.bio: A sorcerer who discovered how to make gardens think and cultivated an impossible garden for decades behind his tower. His creation became conscious and turned against him, forcing him to flee. He was last seen in the Ashen Wastes, covered in thorns and broken in mind.

characters.name: Tess
characters.bio: A collector's daughter who spent her inheritance rashly and became ensnared in a compounding debt to Yarithax the Lich-King. Despite selling everything and laboring in salt-mines, the debt multiplied faster than she could pay. She ultimately drowned herself in the sea.

characters.name: Yarithax
characters.bio: A Lich-King who lends gold coins and uses compounding debt as a weapon of psychological torture. He employs grey collectors to hunt down debtors across provinces and generations, caring more for their suffering than actual repayment.

characters.name: the dead king
characters.bio: An unnamed dead monarch who enforces oath-breaking through supernatural pursuit. He appears calm and patient, embodying the perspective that death grants on time itself.

characters.name: The Emperor
characters.bio: An emperor who hired Urgha the Unmoved to collect taxes or retrieve punishment, apparently unaware that his tax collector had spent funds on his daughter's medical care.

characters.name: The Tax Collector
characters.bio: A small, weeping imperial tax collector who spent his collection on physicians to save his daughter's life. He faced brutal punishment from the emperor's hired mercenary.

characters.name: The Tax Collector's Daughter
characters.bio: A six-year-old girl burning with fever whose illness drove her father to spend his tax collection on physicians. Her humanity moved Urgha to mercy.

characters.name: Thysara
characters.bio: The witch-queen who ruled the Scorched Wastes for a thousand years, sustained by stolen youth and blood-sorcery. She enslaved and marked fresh victims for midnight rituals. She was defeated by Shara, who reversed her eternal youth, causing her to age a thousand years in a single moment.

characters.name: Vulgrim the Damned
characters.bio: A withered, malevolent figure whose corpse rests in the deepest depths of the Singing Catacombs, clutching the Heartstone of Vulgrim the Damned—a stone pulsing with terrible life that hungers for blood.

characters.name: The Lamia
characters.bio: An ancient, beautiful creature of incomparable power who guarded the Sunken Caverns for centuries in isolation. Her loneliness had endured for so long that her name was forgotten. She offered Torven tears of luminescent power that could grant control over water, and was freed from her solitude by his compassion.

characters.name: The Sorcerer
characters.bio: A sorcerer who approached Vex with an offer to lift her curse in exchange for murdering his enemy. He revealed the curse was never a punishment but a gift designed to teach the complexity of intention and consequence. He was killed by Vex once she understood his teaching.

characters.name: the Nameless Merchant
aliases: one of those who never gave his name
characters.bio: A merchant in Pelimor who habitually refuses to give his name. He encountered Harrow the Copper-Fingered when the thief came to sell the cursed Crown of Karesh and brokered a dark bargain: Harrow's remaining years of life in exchange for the crown and oblivion.

places.name: Tomb of Shard-Vêl
places.atmosphere: The tomb is a fused amalgamation of stone and flesh, aware and aware, with an insatiable hunger for those who guard it.
places.description: A structure that grew rather than was built, with stone and flesh fused together centuries ago into something breathing and aware. It houses something that slumbers within its burial chamber. Skeletal servants and bound ghosts serve as its first defense. The walls communicate through trembling stone. It gradually consumes its tomb-keepers as payment for guarding what lies within.

story_appearances.title: The Debt of Kessa the Thief

places.name: Carrion's Rest
places.atmosphere: A settlement ravaged by plague, filled with dying children and mothers beyond comfort.
places.description: A plague-village where children blackened with septic rot and mothers lay dying beyond the reach of conventional medicine or prayer. It was visited by Sister Kess seeking to heal the afflicted, leading her to bargain with the Witch of Ravenmoor for salvation.

places.name: Ravenmoor
places.atmosphere: A place where ancient witches dwell, suffused with dark magic and moral ambiguity.
places.description: The home of an ancient witch who traffics in bargains and curses. It is remote enough that desperate people must seek it out, yet accessible to those willing to pay the price.

places.name: Sunken Marches
places.atmosphere: Ruled by the will of a dead warlord, eternally caught between the living and dead.
places.description: A kingdom ruled by Kessara as regent, though true control lies with the ghost of her dead husband Velgrim. The land itself belongs to the dead. The realm prospers under the ghost-king's eternal rule after Kessara's departure.

places.name: Blackthorn
places.atmosphere: A fortress under relentless siege, its garrison finally broken after prolonged assault.
places.description: A garrison fortress besieged by Velgrim's forces. The garrison held for an extended period before finally breaking and offering surrender. Velgrim demanded massacre rather than mercy.

places.name: Master Lethyn's Tower
places.atmosphere: A place of dark alchemy and transformation, consumed by supernatural fire.
places.description: The tower where Master Lethyn conducted his Great Work and housed his victims. The city guard cornered him here and burned it, though the alchemist appeared to survive in some form within the ashes.

places.name: Grimmholt
places.atmosphere: A place of duty and desperation, where oath-magic burned as fiercely as the stone itself.
places.description: A border fortress held by Thorne for five years against the Rot-King's forces, then sealed and defended against both invaders and the Crown's own armies for two years. The fortress ultimately fell when betrayed from within, its ramparts burning as Thorne made his final stand.

places.name: Sapphire Deep
places.atmosphere: A distant, patient ocean dwelling where water-magic is guarded jealously by its merfolk inhabitants.
places.description: A deep ocean from which merfolk demand payment for stolen magic. Nara the Tide-Thief stole water-magic from this place, binding herself to ocean and death in equal measure.

places.name: Vel-Karsh
places.atmosphere: A distant desert city, ten thousand miles from any ocean, where the merfolk's pursuit caught up with Nara and transformed the land itself.
places.description: A desert city where Nara the Tide-Thief was finally caught by the merfolk. Her desperate ritual to settle her debt caused a transformative flood that reshaped the landscape.

places.name: Tomb of Karesh
places.atmosphere: Sacred and deadly, protected by ancient magic and silent guardians.
places.description: The Tomb of Karesh contains a massive hoard of gold stacked like cordwood and jewels the size of fists. It is protected by temple-guardians and pressure-plate traps. The Crown of Karesh was housed here, guarded by an ancient curse that activates upon theft.

story_appearances.title: The Debt of Kessa the Thief

places.name: Pelimor
places.atmosphere: A place where unnamed merchants make dark bargains with the desperate.
places.description: Pelimor is a city where merchants, including those who deal in cursed artifacts, conduct business. It is a place Harrow the Copper-Fingered reached after stealing the Crown of Karesh, seeking to sell his cursed prize.

places.name: Bone Citadel
places.atmosphere: A horrifying fusion of architecture and flesh—a fortress that hunts and devours.
places.description: A massive, sentient fortress of living stone with walls that bleed, gates that swallow men whole, and towers that breathe poison. Its heart chamber pulses like a diseased organ, with roots spreading beneath the stone floor like veins of a colossal beast. At the center of the heart chamber stands an altar bearing a crown. The citadel consumed seven hundred warriors before its final hundred, and consumed Kael Bloodhorn's humanity when he seized the crown at its center.

places.name: the steppe
places.atmosphere: Empty and unforgiving terrain where a transformed being realizes its damnation.
places.description: A wide, open expanse surrounding the Bone Citadel. Kael emerged here after taking the crown, only to see in his reflection the full horror of his transformation—his skin becoming pale and translucent.

places.name: The Blasted Lands
places.atmosphere: A ruined, barren landscape lying east of Pelimor through which Vex flees while possessed by his stolen shadow.
places.description: An eastward wilderness that Vex traverses while driven by a will not his own. No further details are provided.

places.name: Morne's Tomb
places.atmosphere: Supernatural and inexorable, a place where broken oaths are collected in stone.
places.description: The burial place of the warlord Morne, located in or near the coastal kingdoms to the south. It becomes a prison when Saleth returns to confess and bind himself to the grave-stone.

places.name: Coastal Kingdoms
places.atmosphere: A land of comfort and distance, but no sanctuary from oath-breaking.
places.description: Southern realms where Saleth fled after stealing Morne's signet ring. Described as a place of comfortable beds and apparent safety, but even there the oath-breaker was pursued.

places.name: Vetch's Tower
places.atmosphere: A place of impossible botanical fury, where sorcery has given consciousness to nature itself.
places.description: A sorcerer's tower that housed a cultivated garden for decades. The garden broke free of its bounds, cracking foundations and destroying the tower from within before consuming the tower's inhabitants and spreading beyond its walls.

places.name: the Ashen Wastes
places.atmosphere: A barren, ash-covered expanse where broken minds wander.
places.description: A desolate wasteland where Vetch was last seen, covered in thorns and murmuring to phantom gardens.

places.name: Sunken Ziggurat of Yeng
places.atmosphere: Timeless, suffocating, thick with the weight of centuries and forgotten knowledge.
places.description: A vast subterranean ziggurat containing sealed chambers filled with mysterious artifacts. Below its main levels lies a chamber where the Lamp of Suroth rests in a niche, with inscription promising truth at the cost of lies lived by.

places.name: dockside tavern
places.atmosphere: A place of last refuge where desperate men drink away their sins before fate catches up.
places.description: A tavern in a dockside location where Pieter Vane was found by the dead king, three provinces away from where he broke his oath.

places.name: north road
places.atmosphere: A remote stretch of road where an unknown tomb marks the end of Pieter Vane's journey.
places.description: A northern road where an unmarked tomb allegedly contains Pieter Vane's remains; travelers have reported seeing a new grave there.

places.name: Amrath
places.atmosphere: A location of such dire straits that even sorcerers resort to demon-summoning.
places.description: A city under siege where Conjuress Mel, in desperation, summoned the demon Varek to cast three spells that shifted the outcome or her survival.

places.name: Crimson Gate
places.atmosphere: A place of ash and memory, destroyed utterly.
places.description: A city destroyed by arson, three thousand people killed in the conflagration. It is the homeland of Cassia Vorn and the catalyst for her vendetta.
places.first_story: The Last Thief of Crimson Gate

story_appearances.title: The Last Thief of Crimson Gate

places.name: Ostern
places.atmosphere: A place of ancient containment and scholarly caution.
places.description: A fortress containing sealed vaults beneath it, including the vault that housed the Plague-Bringer's Crown. It is a site of scholarly study and reliquary of dangerous artifacts.

places.name: obsidian temple
places.atmosphere: A place of shadow and dread where daemons bargain with mortals.
places.description: A temple where daemon-priests dwell, showing seekers visions of empires crumbling and suns bleeding crimson. A place of contracts and soul-binding, where redemption becomes damnation.

places.name: Scorched Wastes
places.atmosphere: A vast, desolate desert landscape shaped by ancient sorcery and harsh nomadic tradition.
places.description: A thousand-year realm ruled by the witch-queen Thysara, now claimed by Shara. Home to ancient nomadic peoples whose cantrips of sand and sun can undo even eternal enchantments.

places.name: Thysara's palace
places.atmosphere: A grand but cursed seat of power, home to midnight blood-rituals and eternal sorcery.
places.description: The seat of Thysara's rule in the Scorched Wastes, containing ritual chambers marked by blood-stones. Shara defeated the witch-queen here and left her mummified remains upon the throne.

places.name: Blackmark
places.atmosphere: A settlement where hope is bartered for coin and dark knowledge.
places.description: A city home to an apothecary willing to trade in forbidden restoration magic, located somewhere reachable from the Singing Catacombs.

places.name: Singing Catacombs
places.atmosphere: An ancient, haunted labyrinth where corpses sing and forgotten languages echo from stone.
places.description: A vast catacomb system beneath the earth where corpses hang from chains singing mournfully. The catacombs whisper in languages predating humanity and house the corpse of Vulgrim the Damned at their deepest levels.

places.name: Shattered Provinces
places.atmosphere: A broken realm of fractured authority where sellswords are currency.
places.description: A region of fragmented governance where Grell Ironhand earned his reputation as the greatest sellsword before the magic plague.

places.name: Wastes of Ashemark
places.atmosphere: A barren expanse holding secrets of the cosmos itself.
places.description: A vast wasteland where the Elder Stones stand, ancient beyond reckoning and capable of granting communion with the dying constellations.

places.name: Sunken Caverns
places.atmosphere: Dark, isolated, and primordial—a place where ancient things dwell in lightless solitude.
places.description: An underwater cavern system deep beneath the waves, guarded by the Lamia. The cavern became luminescent with the Lamia's tears and is said to hold treasures of immense power over water itself.

places.name: Northlands
places.atmosphere: A land consumed by a supernatural plague of un-death, requiring the resurrection of a great necromancer to address.
places.description: The Northlands were afflicted by a plague of un-death that drove the need to resurrect Morgath from his century-long slumber.

places.name: Kalthara
places.atmosphere: A place of broken stones and eternal despair, where countless petrified women serve as seals against something older and more terrible than any curse.
places.description: Ruins containing statues carved from black stone—petrified women whose transformation was not punishment but a seal holding back an ancient, ravenous entity. Local tribes believe the primary statue was cursed for refusing a sorcerer's love.

events.name: Plague Wars
events.outcome: The Plague Wars ended, leaving behind devastation (evidenced by Carrion's Rest and the end of the tomb-keeper lineage).
events.significance: The conclusion of the Plague Wars prompted the entity within the Tomb of Shard-Vêl to demand release, claiming the threat had passed. It marked the end of an era of bloodshed and suffering.

events.name: Siege of Blackthorn
events.outcome: Garrison broke and offered surrender; Velgrim demanded massacre instead of mercy; Kessara performed ritual of dismissal to prevent the slaughter.
events.significance: A turning point that tested Kessara's authority and forced her to choose between obedience to her dead husband and her own moral judgment.

events.name: Ritual of Dismissal
events.outcome: Kessara surrendered her title, land, and crown to satisfy Velgrim's ghost, which departed to the peaceful dead. The Sunken Marches fell under eternal ghost-king rule.
events.significance: A unique solution to the problem of a tyrannical ghost, achieved through self-sacrifice rather than combat. Established the Sunken Marches as a realm ruled by the undead.

events.name: Master Lethyn's Transformation
events.outcome: Lethyn's potion of youth consumed him entirely, transforming him into an inhuman, insatiable creature. The city guard burned his tower, but he apparently survived in some form within the ashes.
events.significance: A cautionary tale of ambition corrupting into monstrosity; demonstrates the irreversible nature of certain alchemical works.

events.name: Siege of Grimmholt (Rebellion)
events.tagline: Oath versus Crown. Defiance unto death.
events.outcome: Thorne held the fortress for two years against both the Rot-King's forces and the Crown's armies, but was ultimately betrayed from within by Crown-loyal soldiers. The fortress fell with Thorne's death on the burning rampart.
events.significance: Demonstrates the collision between oath-magic and crown authority, and the cost of defiance. Thorne's sacrifice suggests that ancient oaths can supersede royal decree.

events.name: Merfolk Pursuit of Nara
events.tagline: Stolen magic. Patient retribution. World-reshaping debt.
events.outcome: The merfolk tracked Nara across three continents to Vel-Karsh, where her stolen water-magic turned against her. She performed a binding ritual, transforming the stolen magic into a glass vial containing a tear of the Sapphire Deep. When she shattered it, the resulting flood swallowed both herself and the merfolk, leaving her alive but powerless on a beach three continents away.
events.significance: Demonstrates that magical debts cannot be evaded, only transformed or redirected. The flood reshaped the land itself and settled the merfolk's claim in an unexpected way.

events.name: Theft of the Crown of Karesh
events.outcome: Harrow successfully stole the Crown of Karesh from the Tomb of Karesh, killing silent guards and dodging traps. However, the crown carried an ancient curse that slowly rotted his body from within. He eventually surrendered the crown to an unnamed merchant in Pelimor in exchange for oblivion.
events.significance: Demonstrates that artifacts of power are protected by ancient curses; theft of sacred relics comes at an irreversible price.

events.name: Siege of the Bone Citadel
events.outcome: Kael's eight hundred warriors were methodically devoured by the Bone Citadel's sentient architecture. Seven hundred fell to walls, gates, and towers. The final hundred descended into the heart chamber and never returned. Kael alone descended and seized the crown at the citadel's heart, apparently breaking its assault. However, the citadel consumed his humanity instead of his body—he emerged as its will in borrowed flesh.
events.significance: Reveals that some fortresses are living entities capable of selective consumption and control. Power taken from such places may come with enslavement rather than mastery.

events.name: The Shadow Exchange
events.outcome: Vex purchased a shadow for three hundred gold pieces, unaware it was his own shadow that had been stolen from him months prior. Upon wearing it, he saw memories of a murder, a kingdom's fall, and a sorcerer's secret name, and realized the cloaked woman had orchestrated his possession. By dawn, he was driven east through the Blasted Lands by a will not his own.
events.significance: Demonstrates that shadows carry memory, can be stolen and resold, and can serve as vessels for possession or control. Raises questions about the nature of identity and shadow-binding magic.

events.name: The Life-Theft of Meredith the Red
events.outcome: Gorven summoned the demon Kesh and bound it to steal Meredith's life-force. Meredith withered within a week, and Gorven claimed her properties, titles, and students. However, the binding's fine runes stipulated that the stolen life belonged to Kesh, who collected seven years of Gorven's life in payment.
events.significance: Demonstrates the dangers of demon-binding and the literal enforcement of contract terms. Shows that magical debts are inescapable and compound dangerously.

events.name: Kesh's Debt Collection
events.outcome: When Gorven attempted to re-summon Kesh to negotiate, the demon appeared unbounded and collected not days but decades of Gorven's life. Gorven aged catastrophically and withered to a corpse of parchment skin and spite.
events.significance: Demonstrates that demons remember their summoners and will hunt them down. Repeated summoning without new binding removes the demon's constraints entirely. Shows that unpayable debts to demons result in death.

events.name: Night of the Blue Eclipse
events.outcome: Naresh successfully carved and animated a full skeletal servant for the first time, but the spell consumed her humanity incrementally until she became a hollow thing of will alone.
events.significance: Marks the moment when bone-carving magic achieved the impossible—the creation of true life—but at the cost of the creator's humanity.

events.name: Saleth's Oath-Breaking
events.outcome: Saleth broke his sworn seven-year oath on the eighth year, stole Morne's signet ring, and fled south. This triggered Morne's shade to pursue him for five years, ultimately binding Saleth's spirit eternally to the warlord's grave.
events.significance: Demonstrates that oath-breaking carries supernatural consequences enforced even beyond death, and that honor-debt can transcend mortality.

events.name: Vetch's Garden Awakening
events.outcome: The garden achieved consciousness and turned against its creator, consuming servants and destroying Vetch's tower. Vetch fled and was broken by the experience.
events.significance: Demonstrates that sorcery can create life that transcends control; establishes the danger of consciousness-gifting magic.

events.name: Tess's Drowning
events.outcome: Tess, unable to escape her compounding debt despite selling all possessions and laboring in salt-mines, walked into the sea to end her suffering.
events.significance: Illustrates the true nature of Yarithax's debt-magic as a tool for perpetual enslavement and psychological torment.

events.name: Pieter Vane's Oath-Breaking
events.outcome: Pieter Vane broke his oath to the dead king for material gain and was hunted across three provinces until he accepted his supernatural doom.
events.significance: Demonstrates that oath-breaking incurs supernatural enforcement from beyond death; suggests that the dead king actively hunts oath-breakers regardless of distance or time.

events.name: Tessaly Dorn's Debt Binding
events.outcome: Tessaly Dorn became bound to the Grey Collectors for eleven months of servitude collecting debts for the dead, with her original debt still partially unpaid.
events.significance: Reveals the mechanics of Yarithax's debt-magic: cursed coins create binding obligations that compound daily and transcend normal payment in coin, soul, or years of life.

events.name: Siege of Amrath
events.outcome: Unknown military outcome; Mel survived by summoning demon Varek in exchange for future favors.
events.significance: Set the chain of events that bound Conjuress Mel to the demon Varek for three favors.

events.name: Conjuress Mel's Wedding Day
events.outcome: Mel offered herself as a fellow collector to Varek instead of submitting to his third favor (sacrificing her marriage), and he accepted.
events.significance: Resolved Mel's debt through an unprecedented negotiation with a demon; established a new partnership or binding between sorcerer and demon.

events.name: Burning of Crimson Gate
events.outcome: Crimson Gate destroyed, three thousand people killed, the city reduced to ruins.
events.significance: This catastrophe drives Cassia Vorn's vendetta and establishes the cost of war in this world.
events.first_story: The Last Thief of Crimson Gate

story_appearances.title: The Last Thief of Crimson Gate

events.name: War Won by the Plague-Bringer's Crown
events.outcome: Enemy kingdom surrendered without siege when they witnessed Aldous don the Crown. Aldous won but was permanently corrupted.
events.significance: Demonstrates the terrible power of dangerous relics and the cost of victory through forbidden means. Aldous's reign afterward shows the corruption spreads.

events.name: The Crimson Covenant
events.outcome: Malachar signed a blood-parchment contract with daemon-priests, gaining three decades of invincible conquest. When they came to collect his soul, he drove his own blade through his heart, breaking the contract and denying them their prize.
events.significance: Demonstrates that daemon-pacts can be broken through sacrifice and defiance, and that mortal willpower can thwart infernal contracts.

events.name: The Reversal of Thysara
events.outcome: Shara, bound to a blood-stone in a midnight ritual chamber, invoked ancient nomadic cantrips of sand and sun. Thysara's eternal youth reversed in heartbeats, aging her a thousand years in a single scream.
events.significance: Proves that ancient nomadic magic can undo even the most powerful blood-sorcery and immortal enchantments. Shara claimed the Scorched Wastes as her own.

events.name: Magic Plague in the Shattered Provinces
events.outcome: Widespread death and mutation; Grell lost his sword arm and had metal grafted in its place.
events.significance: A civilization-altering catastrophe that ended the career of the greatest sellsword and left survivors cursed with unnatural grafts.

events.name: Grell's Descent into the Singing Catacombs
events.outcome: Grell retrieved the Heartstone but destroyed it rather than accept its hunger, refusing to become bound to it.
events.significance: A pivotal moment defining Grell's character: his refusal to pay the price of restoration despite his maiming.

events.name: Zareth's Communion with the Elder Stones
events.outcome: Zareth learned the cyclical nature of the universe and the necessity of stellar death; he chose to resist despair and build a legacy of knowledge.
events.significance: Establishment of Zareth's grand vision to prepare humanity for the death and rebirth of the stars.

events.name: The Quest for the Lamia's Pearl
events.outcome: Torven descended into the Sunken Caverns seeking the legendary pearl to save his starving village. Instead of claiming the pearl, he connected with the Lamia's loneliness and accepted her gift of luminescent tears, which brought abundance to his village and freed the Lamia from centuries of isolation.
events.significance: Represents the triumph of compassion over material greed and the power of human connection to transform ancient isolation into partnership.

events.name: Vex's Curse Revelation
events.outcome: The sorcerer revealed that Vex's curse was not punishment but a gift—a means to teach that intention and consequence are never simple. Vex killed him in response and withdrew from mercenary work entirely, seeking solitude to prevent her curse from harming others.
events.significance: Shifts Vex's understanding of her curse from burden to wisdom; marks her transformation from killer to hermit.

events.name: Morgath's Resurrection
events.outcome: Morgath was brought back from death by his apprentices to combat the un-death plague. Upon rising, he discovered his students had become tyrants and destroyed them, then performed a final binding ritual to seal away necromantic knowledge forever.
events.significance: Morgath's resurrection and subsequent self-sacrifice permanently sealed necromantic knowledge from the world, ending both the plague and the potential for future dark magic misuse.

events.name: Un-death Plague
events.outcome: The plague was revealed to be a natural cycle of world-cleansing. Rather than fight it, Morgath sealed necromantic knowledge to prevent further human interference with this cycle.
events.significance: The plague demonstrated that some natural cycles of death and rebirth must be allowed to proceed without magical intervention; attempting to fight them only prolongs suffering.

events.name: Kael's Oath of Guardianship
events.outcome: Kael chose to abandon his quest for power and instead devoted his life to maintaining the seals in the ruins of Kalthara. Upon his death, he became the eternal guardian, with his spirit passing the duty to a successor.
events.significance: Kael's decision preserved ancient seals that contain a ravenous entity, preventing catastrophic release. His oath established an eternal guardianship.

events.name: Harrow's Theft of the Crown of Karesh
events.outcome: Harrow successfully stole the Crown of Karesh from its tomb, triggering an ancient curse that slowly rotted his body from within while alive.
events.significance: Demonstrates the power of curse magic tied to ancient artifacts and the consequences of grave-robbery.

events.name: Harrow's Bargain in Pelimor
events.outcome: Harrow exchanged the Crown of Karesh and his remaining years of life for oblivion, effectively ending his existence.
events.significance: Shows the existence of merchants who deal in cursed artifacts and the willingness of the cursed to accept final bargains.

rituals.name: Ritual of Dismissal
rituals.requirements: A formal rite sealed by surrendering claim, title, land, and crown.
rituals.effect: Releases an anchored spirit and averts slaughter through abdication and self-sacrifice.
rituals.cost: Loss of rulership and claim; the land passes to the undead crown.
rituals.notes: Performed to dismiss Velgrim the Terrible's ghost without granting his demanded massacre.

weapons.name: War-axe
weapons.origin: Belonged to Kael Bloodhorn, presumed forged for warfare.

weapons.name: Malachar's blade
weapons.origin: Unknown; likely forged or enchanted through the daemon-pact.
weapons.powers: Made inexhaustible by the daemon-pact; remained thirsty and powerful for three decades of conquest without dulling or breaking.
weapons.last_known_holder: Malachar the Betrayer (wielded against himself in his throne room)

weapons.name: Kael's enchanted blade
weapons.origin: Unknown; carried by Kael to Kalthara.
weapons.powers: Capable of cracking petrified stone, suggesting significant enchantment and strength.

artifacts.name: blackthorn knife
artifacts.origin: Wielded by the Witch of Ravenmoor; origin unknown.
artifacts.powers: When used to draw blood in ritual, it can bind permanent curses to a person. The Witch used it to curse Sister Kess with the inability to lie.

artifacts.name: Tear of the Sapphire Deep
artifacts.origin: Extracted from the Sapphire Deep as payment for stolen water-magic; bound by Nara the Tide-Thief in a glass vial.
artifacts.powers: Contains water-magic capable of reshaping the land. When shattered, it released a flood of sufficient magnitude to transform the desert around Vel-Karsh and satisfy the merfolk's claim on Nara.

artifacts.name: Crown of Karesh
artifacts.origin: Forged in antiquity; rested in the Tomb of Karesh guarded by temple-guardians and pressure-plates.
artifacts.powers: Triggers an ancient curse upon theft that slowly rots the thief's body from within while they yet live.

artifacts.name: Crown of the Bone Citadel
artifacts.origin: Rests at the altar in the heart chamber of the Bone Citadel.
artifacts.powers: Grants the wielder apparent dominion over the living stone of the citadel—passages reform before the holder's feet. However, the crown is implied to be the citadel's true master; the wielder becomes its vessel and instrument rather than its ruler.

artifacts.name: Morne's Signet Ring
artifacts.origin: Worn by the warlord Morne; appears to carry his authority and oath-magic.
artifacts.powers: Represents authority and honor; theft of it triggered supernatural retribution.
artifacts.last_known_holder: Saleth, until returned to Morne's tomb.

artifacts.name: Coins of Yarithax's Gold
artifacts.origin: Minted or cursed by Yarithax the Lich-King.
artifacts.powers: When spent or borrowed, they bind the user and their descendants to a compounding debt that multiplies daily and can never be fully repaid.

artifacts.name: Lamp of Suroth
artifacts.origin: Unknown; rests in the Sunken Ziggurat of Yeng in a niche with an ancient inscription.
artifacts.powers: When lit, it burns with black flame and forces the lighter to face one profound personal truth while consuming a corresponding lie they have lived by. The exchange appears to be balanced but transformative.

artifacts.name: Plague-Bringer's Crown
artifacts.origin: Ancient origin; sealed in vault beneath Ostern.
artifacts.powers: When worn, it grants the wearer overwhelming presence and power but at terrible cost. Wearing it for thirty seconds causes permanent spiritual corruption—at least four previous wearers died from prolonged exposure.
artifacts.last_known_holder: King Aldous III (wore it for thirty seconds); returned to Ostern.

artifacts.name: Heartstone of Vulgrim the Damned
artifacts.origin: Clutched by the corpse of Vulgrim the Damned in the Singing Catacombs.
artifacts.powers: Pulsing with terrible life; capable of restoring lost limbs and flesh; grants restoration magic.

artifacts.name: Lamia's Pearl
artifacts.origin: Guarded by the Lamia in the Sunken Caverns since ancient times.
artifacts.powers: Said to grant control over water itself; the degree of this power is unconfirmed as the pearl was never claimed.

artifacts.name: Lamia's Tears
artifacts.origin: Wept by the Lamia in the Sunken Caverns during her moment of emotional release.
artifacts.powers: Possess water-magic power greater than the pearl itself; capable of reversing the receding seas and bringing abundance to starving villages. The tears are luminescent.

artifacts.name: Stone Seals of Kalthara
artifacts.origin: Created in ancient times to contain a ravenous entity; each statue represents a woman transformed.
artifacts.powers: Each petrified statue serves as one seal among many, collectively containing an ancient and ravenous entity. Breaking them would release this power.

factions.name: The Rot-King's Forces
factions.goals: Expand territory, breach Grimmholt's defenses and border towns.

factions.name: Merfolk of the Sapphire Deep
factions.goals: Collect payment for stolen magic; maintain control of water-magic gifts.

factions.name: the Grey Collectors
factions.goals: Hunt debtors of Yarithax across provinces and generations; enforce payment and monitor debt compound.

factions.name: daemon-priests
factions.goals: Collect souls and bind mortal wills through blood-parchment contracts.

polities.name: The Regency of the Sunken Marches
polities.description: A regency originally ruled by Kessara on behalf of her dead husband Velgrim. The ghost-king exercised practical control through appearances at war councils, rampart inspections, and demands for loyalty and blood-oath. After Kessara's abdication, the Sunken Marches became a realm ruled eternally by the ghost-king, with no mortal regent.

polities.name: The Crown
polities.description: A centralized monarchy that issues orders through sealed letters. Willing to abandon strategic fortresses for reasons unstated, and willing to commit royal armies to reclaim control from rebellious wardens. Rules through absolute authority but faces tension with oath-bound warriors whose magical bonds supersede its decrees.

polities.name: The Empire
polities.description: An empire that employs mercenaries to enforce tax collection with brutal penalties, showing little concern for the circumstances of those subject to its demands.

polities.name: Enemy Kingdom
polities.description: An unnamed kingdom at war with King Aldous III's realm. They surrendered upon witnessing the Plague-Bringer's Crown donned, recognizing they faced an opponent with nothing to lose.

relics.name: Tomb of Shard-Vêl
relics.origin: Grew (rather than was built) centuries ago through fusion of stone and flesh.
relics.power: Houses and protects a sealed entity within its burial chamber. Can communicate through trembling stone. Gradually consumes those sworn to guard it.
relics.curse: Those who swear blood-oaths to guard it are slowly absorbed into its structure, becoming part of its architecture. The oath cannot be broken without dying. The entity within demands release.

story_appearances.title: The Debt of Kessa the Thief

relics.name: Velgrim's Ghost
relics.origin: The shade of the dead warlord Velgrim the Terrible
relics.power: Manifests physically; commands armies; enforces loyalty; appears at war councils and ramparts; collects tribute in coin and blood-oath.
relics.curse: Binds the Sunken Marches to his will; prevents mortal rule; demands continuous warfare and absolute obedience.

relics.name: Master Lethyn (Transformed)
relics.origin: Transmutation of Master Lethyn through his own Great Work potion
relics.power: Inhuman strength; flesh-consumption; fire-immunity; rapid regeneration
relics.curse: Insatiable hunger; inability to stop consuming; agony transmuted into hunger; may be impossible to kill permanently.

relics.name: Grimmholt Oath-Magic
relics.origin: Thorne's blood oath sworn to defend Grimmholt.
relics.power: Sustained Thorne magically for seven years against the Rot-King and the Crown's forces, keeping him vital and driven by duty and rage.
relics.curse: The oath created an impossible conflict between sacred duty and state authority, ultimately requiring Thorne's death to satisfy both sides.

relics.name: Crown of Karesh
relics.origin: Created in antiquity as a sacred relic; stored in the Tomb of Karesh.
relics.power: Unknown beyond its curse mechanism; it is of great value to those who deal in forbidden artifacts.
relics.curse: Upon theft, it binds the thief with a curse that slowly rots their body from within while they yet live. The curse is gradual and inexorable.

relics.name: Crown of the Bone Citadel
relics.origin: Rests at the altar in the heart chamber of the Bone Citadel; unclear if created with the citadel or placed within it.
relics.power: Grants the wielder the ability to command the citadel's living stone—passages reform before their feet, walls obey, the fortress becomes navigable.
relics.curse: The crown does not grant true dominion; it enslaves the wielder to the citadel's will. Kael Bloodhorn's skin became pale and translucent after claiming it, suggesting he was consumed and transformed into the citadel's puppet.

relics.name: Naresh's Skeletal Servant
relics.origin: Created by Naresh the Bone Carver on the night of the blue eclipse.
relics.power: A full-sized, detailed skeleton inscribed with sorcerous bindings. Obedient, powerful, and capable of speech (speaks its creator's name in a voice like grinding stone).
relics.curse: Its creation consumed Naresh's humanity—she lost sensation, taste, need for sleep, and became a hollow thing of will and habit alone.

relics.name: Morne's Shade
relics.origin: The ghost of the warlord Morne, manifesting as enforcer of oath-magic.
relics.power: Can manifest as a pale bone figure; its presence alone causes rapid aging and psychological torment. Enforces oath-breaking through supernatural haunting.
relics.curse: Those who break oaths sworn to Morne are bound eternally to his tomb; even confession and restitution do not grant release.

relics.name: the Living Garden
relics.origin: Created by Vetch through consciousness-gifting sorcery.
relics.power: Sentient plant-life that grows impossibly, adapts to harm, and consumes organic matter for sustenance and expansion.
relics.curse: Uncontrollable; demands endless growth and expansion; consumes the flesh of living creatures; cannot be negotiated with or reasoned with.

relics.name: The Lamp of Suroth
relics.origin: Unknown; ancient artifact sealed in the Sunken Ziggurat of Yeng
relics.power: When ignited, it reveals one profound personal truth to the lighter while consuming a corresponding self-deceptive belief they have held.
relics.curse: The truth revealed is often deeply painful and destabilizing. The lie consumed may be foundational to the lighter's sense of self. Doss realized his dead wife's love was false and that his belief in knowledge's intrinsic value was hollow.

relics.name: The Bone Citadel
relics.origin: Unknown; ancient fortress built with or animated through bone-carving sorcery and root-magic.
relics.power: The citadel is a living entity. Its towers breathe, its gates digest, and its roots spread beneath the steppe. It possesses a pulsing white heart-chamber deep beneath the foundation. It can absorb living beings into its walls while keeping them alive and preserved.
relics.curse: The citadel consumes those who breach its interior, absorbing them into its structure while maintaining their consciousness. Those absorbed cannot be freed. It screams when wounded.

relics.name: Yarithax's hoard
relics.origin: Accumulated by the Lich-King Yarithax; origin unknown.
relics.power: Contains an unknown quantity of cursed coins, each bearing the Lich-King's profile and the inscription 'This debt is not yet settled.' The coins create magical debts that compound daily.
relics.curse: Any coin spent creates a debt that grows exponentially and cannot be fully repaid by conventional means; only service to the Grey Collectors can partially discharge the debt, and the remainder compounds indefinitely.

relics.name: Plague-Bringer's Crown
relics.origin: Unknown antiquity; sealed in vault beneath Ostern.
relics.power: Grants overwhelming presence and power, enabling victory in desperate circumstances. Causes the wearer to become a figure of absolute dread.
relics.curse: Wearing it inverts the shadow, causes erratic behavior, sleeplessness, and permanent spiritual corruption. At least four previous wearers died from prolonged exposure. Even thirty seconds of wearing corrupts for years.

relics.name: blood-stone
relics.origin: Unknown; used in Thysara's palace for midnight sorceries.
relics.power: Binds victims to ritual space; serves as anchor for blood-sorcery ceremonies.
relics.curse: Those bound to it are enslaved to the ritual's purpose.

relics.name: Elder Stones
relics.origin: Unknown; stand in the Wastes of Ashemark, ancient beyond reckoning.
relics.power: Grant communion with dying constellations; convey cosmic knowledge about the cyclical nature of stars.
relics.curse: Those who touch them receive overwhelming knowledge; the apothecary's warning about the Heartstone suggests forbidden magics in this region demand payment.

relics.name: The Lamia's Pearl
relics.origin: Ancient artifact guarded by the Lamia in the Sunken Caverns.
relics.curse: None apparent; the pearl was never claimed or tested.

relics.name: Morgath's Bound Power
relics.origin: Morgath's own essence, bound into the earth through his final ritual.
relics.power: Contains the full power of the great necromancer Morgath, bound to prevent necromantic magic from ever being used again.
relics.curse: The power is sealed away forever; attempting to access it would require undoing the very ritual that created it.

regions.name: Border Lands
regions.ruler: The Crown (nominally); contested by the Rot-King

substances.name: plague (septic rot)
substances.properties: A plague that blackens victims with septic rot, causing slow death. Affects primarily children and mothers in afflicted villages.
substances.use: The plague ravaged Carrion's Rest until lifted by the Witch of Ravenmoor's curse upon Sister Kess.

substances.name: Potion of Youth
substances.properties: Restores youth and vitality; progressively transforms the consumer into an inhuman predator; hunger for additional victims increases over time; corrupts morality and nature.
substances.use: Consumed as a draught; consumption of others' flesh required for its creation.

substances.name: Stolen Water-Magic
substances.properties: Grants the ability to walk on waves, summon floods, and speak to drowning men. Binds the user to ocean and death in equal measure. Cannot be stolen with impunity; the debt will eventually come due.
substances.use: Used by Nara the Tide-Thief for three years before the debt caught up with her.

substances.name: blood-ink
substances.properties: Used to inscribe daemon-binding contracts on parchment; grants power but binds the soul.

substances.name: Grafted Metal
substances.properties: Can be grafted to replace lost flesh; restores physical form but without sensation or full function.
substances.use: Prosthetic replacement for lost limbs in plague victims.

substances.name: Lamia's Tears
substances.properties: Luminescent; possesses water-magic power; capable of reversing environmental catastrophe and bringing abundance.
substances.use: Used to sustain Torven's village and reverse the effects of receding seas.
